parameter 1: "Everybody Rock 'n' Roll The Place" by Eddie Money is replaced on the DVD, with some dialogue cut. The episode originally started with Les singing "Heartbreak Hotel"; that scene has also been cut.
parameter 2: "Everybody Rock 'n' Roll The Place" by Eddie Money is replaced on the DVD, with some dialogue cut. The episode originally started with Les singing "Heartbreak Hotel"; that scene has also been cut.
parameter 3: All songs replaced in 90's redistribution package and DVD release.
parameter 4: In the 90's syndication package, some footage is cut from the beginning to eliminate "Suction Prints" by Captain Beefheart and Johnny's corresponding announcement. The Nicolette Larson song that Johnny plays at the end is replaced by a reprise of the WKRP ending theme. Johnny's announcement is also lost.
parameter 5: "Queen of the Forest" by Ted Nugent (the very first rock song Johnny Fever plays on WKRP) is replaced with generic music on the 90's redistribution package and DVD release. Interestingly, though, except on the DVD release, the Nugent song is intact when the scene is repeated in two other episodes, which proves nothing except that the process of licensing music for this package was pretty haphazard. At least that's Howard Hesseman's real voice saying "booger". In the tag, the song Venus plays, "Dance, Dance, Dance" by Chic, has been replaced.
parameter 6: The song Herb sings as he walks into the lobby is redubbed on the late 90's redistribution package, and so is his line "Hi Bailey."  to "Hi, babe."
parameter 7: In the 90's redistribution package, the opening theme to Real Families is replaced by a different generic theme and thus has a different announcer. All the rock songs that WKRP plays are still present, except that the music that plays while Venus talks about the dancing ducks promotion might be stock music.
